lots.title: TransQ Qualification System |notification of qualification system - Services
lots.description: TRANSQ is a joint qualification system for suppliers and contractors to leading Scandinavian transport and postal utilities. It's operated by Achilles under Article 77 of Directive 2014/25/EU. The subscribing utilities will use TRANSQ for tenderer selection for contracts and framework agreements subject to EU procurement rules but reserve the right to publish individual notices for specific requirements where they deem it necessary, even though they relate to the product and service categories covered by TRANSQ. The qualification system may be used for contracts not subject to EU procurement rules at each subscriber's discretion. An overview of products and services acquired through TRANSQ is available here https://www.achilles.com/app/uploads/2018/04/Achilles-TransQ-Nordics-Codes-En.pdf

criteria.description: Price is not the only award criterion and all criteria are stated only in the procurement documents.

renewal.description: TRANQ is of indefinite duration, but supplier information must be updated annually. Suppliers already qualified on TRANSQ will be reminded to renew before the qualification period expires. The annual qualification fee is ranging from SEK 5,680 to 11,220 payable in advance. Suppliers can update their information during the qualification period.

criteria.description: Please find more information about the qualification requirements and required documentation here https://www.achilles.com/community/transq-nordics/

parties.name: Achilles Information AS on behalf of the Transport and Post utilities listed in Section VI.3)

classifications.description: Activities related to the provision or operation of networks providing a service to the public in the field of transport by railway.

description: Participating utilities (see https://www.achilles.no/Notices/TransQ/Annual-Notice-Jul2023.pdf for details): Avinor AS (Norway), Bane NOR SF (Norway), Oslo kommune Fornebubanen (Norway), Posten Norge (Norway), Sporveien AS (Norway), Vygruppen AS (Norway) including subsidiaries and associated companies, Agilia AS (Norway), Vy Gjøvikbanen (Norway), Vy Buss AS (Norway), Flåm Utvikling AS (Norway), Region Stockholm, Trafiknämnden, Förvaltning för utbyggd tunnelbana (Sweden), Region Stockholm, Trafiknämnden, Inköp och Upphandling (Sweden), SJ (Sweden), Swedavia AB (Sweden), Trafikverket (Sweden).
